result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Kou Chee Yang

records.addlTxt:
Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Erik Eisenmann is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $100.00 per Month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on December 1, 2022.  $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court. 
Mailed copy to DE on 11/1

8:32 AM Defendant Thomas Kou Chee Yang appeared by phone.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Court in receipt of court appts paperwork filed by deft. Deft states he would like a court apptd atty. Court sets $100/month payment plan due on or before 12.1.22 and each month thereafter and will work with judicial asst to find an atty. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Deft to call judicial asst in about a week or two to get atty name.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Plea hearing on November 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
